>>33897245
>Where do you end up after you die?

I'm gonna mention NDE's, but I promise I'm not this guy: >>33898024

If we're taking Near Death Experiences at face value (and there's no reason not to since they're objectively the most relevant accounts of death we have) then there's a couple possible destinations after death.

>Heaven
Most people seem to end up in Heaven. Heaven is fairly consistent and what you'd generally expect it to be: a pastoral idealized realm with flowers, meadows, low-hanging, clouds, that's habituated by gods, angels, (including animals) and where your *deceased friends and family are waiting for you. Really great place.
*There was a recent NDE making the headlines where a woman went up and her dead aunt was there waiting for her and during their reunion the aunt commented something to the effect of, "I'm surprised God could lift you up here. Look at how fat you've gotten." Which is good because it means we retain our identities.

>Hell
A very small minority of people, like less than 10%, will be going to Hell. Hell is an exceptional spiritual realm that seems to be the designation for people who've completely given up. They have no friends, no family, and they maye even despise themselves for that matter. Suicide victims seem to fairly consistently go to Hell and those with very poor, selfish, or abusive social relationships.
Hell, however, is by no means a prison. The 'exit' to Hell is not locked, people can come and go as they please and there's numerous accounts of people escaping Hell: some made the ardous journey themselves, some were escorted out by a god or angel, others still were either rode or carried out by a deceased pet. Even if you had no love for yourself it seems the love you had for others is sufficient to carry you out of damnation.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33899824

>Star Stuff/"Space Jellyfish"
Some people don't go to either Heaven nor Hell and instead levitate out of their bodies and find themselves gravitating higher and higher before they're up in space. These people percieve themselves as a little orb of light, a shooting star, or a "Jellyfish": untethered by anything and fully capable of free movement through space.
People ascending into space to become a star-child don't meet the Godhead, nor do the meet dead relatives, but while lingering on in the space above the atmosphere they do reacount meeting other star jellyfish. These other jellies often warn them that the journey into space, while rewarding and full of adventure, is extremely lonely.

Some other stuff I feel I should mention that I couldn't get into the other post:
-Religion doesn't seem to matter. At all. People encounter gods they're familiar with, but Atheists still encounter "Luminous Beings dressed in white robes." little gods and angels probably exist, but their 'presentation' might be cultural masks for our benefit.
-Hell is very much a self-imposed exile. The people in Hell keep themselves in there and the Demons that dwell in there are happy to torture them, but anybody who doesn't think they deserve Hell can't *actually* be kept there beyond just being convinced to stay.
-Animals seem to have more of an influence on this then people expect. Lots of people are dragged out of Hell on horses, dogs, even pet birds, they've kept in life, and Heaven is reported to be occupied by Animals. Animals seem to come and go wherever they please or are needed.
-The Godhead uniformly hasn't been condoning homosexuals. The singular barometer of divine judgement really does just seem to exclusively be how empathetic you were in life and the kindness you had for others. The Lord Godhead will make the hatred and pain you've done to others your own, and the love and good you've done to others your own glory.

Naw, naw, I know what you mean. It's fine.

If you want to get into it; I'm not married to the "Heaven Vs Hell" Biblical Terminology. I just use it because it's a convenient anchor/root word to provide people some basic context into whatever I'm talking about.

It sounds like, though, you want to get a little more into the meat of things and for that I'll say I think we're on the same/similar page in that our Souls don't arbitrarily start existing when we die. Souls always exist, but they're most likely far too preoccupied with the comings and goings of the *material world to have a greater presense, and furthermore; the substantive development that takes place while being alive is probably very important to the maturation and actual 'consciousness' of a Soul. There's plenty of people who don't linger on and seemingly cease to exist. Maybe they don't know, or have never known, they've existed and so it's right back into the system for them with a brand new birth.

*I don't have it on me, but there was a recent study in psychic phenomenae done at the University of Oslo in Norway. Mind you it was a very small smaple size (only around 42 people and most of them men), but they were interested in quantifying some of these psychic-hoo-haery and the Doctor managing it made an interesting comment.
Most psychic shenanigans can only be replicated in a period of sensory deprivation. Your brain, when deprived of physical sensation or stimulai, or perhaps the anima/force/whatever that occupies you, begins to act out and widen it's ability to percieve reality beyond those physical means.

>Most psychic shenanigans can only be replicated in a period of sensory deprivation. Your brain, when deprived of physical sensation or stimulai, or perhaps the anima/force/whatever that occupies you, begins to act out and widen it's ability to percieve reality beyond those physical means.

'specifically, the job of a case officer. A case/operations officer is a type of glowie which deals primarily with HUMINT, which is basically just human intelligence gathered mostly through interpersonal human contact. In other words, these glowies deal with people. Oftentimes, they are usually tasked with recruiting natives (called agents) of whatever region they are operating in and turning them into either informants, or having them infiltrate a circle of people the glowie is targeting, called "running an agent"

At first, my hypothetical larp qt glowie case officer would probably take a different approach to the usual way of dealing with agents. The usual way being through fear or coercion, "I'll give you to the (insert corrupt police or security agency here) and they will hurt you bad and arrest your family unless you tell me what I need to know" etc and while this method can get results, it's not always the most accurate method because it is based on a relationship of fear and mistrust. Instead the glowie went for an alternative approach. Glowie saw the "agents" as humans. And as humans they each had fears, desires, goals, everything that the glowie had the source/agent had as well. But most important to the glowie, the agents have intelligence or access to intelligence that she requires. She NEEDS these human beings. Not the other way around. I wonder if sometimes the brain doesn't just fart out shit we expect to see. This story reminded me of the time I picked up my cousin who was babysitting his sister's boys. She had 5 and 4 year old and my cousin's daughter was 3 at the time. I pull up to the house and honk, and my cousin opens up the door and waves at me through the screen door. I can see clearly into the house and he goes and finishes up talking to his sis and gets a plate of food or something. The whole time he's doing this I can clearly see his daughter bouncing around him excited to go home. She's in one of those little onesies with the white padded feet, and got a big puffy purple jacket on. Nothing out of the ordinary. So I dick around on my phone for a bit til I see them come out, and the baby girl comes out right behind her dad and I lose sight of her as she runs up to the SUV I'm in. My cousin opens his door and greets me as he settles into his seat. And as he closes his door I just look past him into the side mirror to see where the baby is and don't see jack. Then I look at him like, "Dude, are you gonna just leave your baby outside?" And he looks at me like I'm nuts and says "She's at her mom's." I wasn't really creeped out by it at all but it still kinda blows my mind to this day how I legit saw something that wasn't there, supposedly.

The third season, which was never produced due to the show getting cancelled, albeit not having that abysmal ratings, is where it gets interesting.

It was supposed to go something like this:
>The season would reveal that thousands of years ago, Earth passed through a comet's tail which deposited viral material that killed 97% of the human race. The breeding cult preserved the survivors' genetic immunity so that when the comet returned, only members of the cult would survive. Sandeman, a cult member, and Max's creator betrayed the cult and decided to give this genetic immunity to the rest of humanity through Max, who would be the savior of the human race. There were multiple ideas on how to spread Max's immunity, including an air burst that would disperse the antibody through the atmosphere, or attaching the immunity to a common cold virus (Eglee detailed how a scene would show Original Cindy sneezing as part of the beginning of the immunity spread).

Now we have the comet, and we have the flu. Then we have the vaccine and a cult-like behavior around forcing it. Of course it can mean nothing, or it may be completely upside down. Anyway, interesting.

One thing I thought about that's interesting along with what OP is saying is that even within HAM radio now there's alternate "internets" that aren't allowed encryption in USA, but nonetheless are still basically internet and SMS systems without relying on a centralized telecom IP service. This is things like the AMPRNet, but also more "normal" protocols like DMR and DSTAR that also have text, picture, GPS, and page capabilities. To me it's entirely feasible for the "elites" to have their own wireless networks totally away from any commercial IP system. Indeed legally businesses are allowed this, too, with an FCC Business radio license you're allowed encryption and to do whatever you want on your frequency. Even without a license using repeater systems and amplifiers you can long range LAN networks on 900mhz, 2.4, and 5ghz Wi-Fi systems, by long range meaning 20-30 miles in some cases.

https://www.radiolabs.com/wireless/wireless-bridge-kits/5-ghz-bridge/5ghz-bridge-wireless-long-range-nlos/

There's a lot going on the airwaves than we think, and to me the idea of a parallel internet seems more likely.

Bloomberg terminals still offer the option of getting your own private T3 line from Bloomberg directly into your business, with no internet traffic going over said line.

Without radio is that you can still have direct connections via POTS, plain old telephone, via modem to modem connections. Problem is Ajit Pai actually deregulated POTS copper telephone line systems, so actual non-VOIP POTS systems cost quite a lot per line now, but many businesses still use them for things like ATMs, alarm systems, payment processing, etc, due to inherent security of something never touching IP network space.

Lastly, for real fun satellite still exists, and a sufficiently funded business or government can have its own satellite up and down links. The reason you see satellite dishes on gas stations and other stores is for payment processing, so payments never need to touch IP space, but also if local internet goes down for any reason payments still remain operational.

>What is the best way to practice remote viewing? I have been practicing with coordinates in a journal.
Learn an established method (like CRV, TRV, TDS) and master it. Use online target pools to obtain targets. Consistent practice (ideally daily) is the key to success. Practice, practice, practice, whether the conditions are ideal or not.
>Also how do you eliminate noise (imagination, memories, etc.) that interferes with psychic intuition?
Declare your AOLs, write them down, put down the pen and mentally dump them. Then resume with the session. Move at a metronomic and steady pace throughout your session to prevent AOLs/noise etc. Meditating daily also helps.

posts.name: Anonymous

>>33883871
Look up "kebatinan". The root word "bātin" is Arabic and means "inner" among other things. Malay silat inherited esoteric aspects of Islam, but also retains some Shaiva-Buddhist elements from those religions that Malay people practiced before the arrival of Islam. Filipinos also have similar admixtures, but because Christianity won out in that sphere, the esoteric aspects (if any) of stuff like Escrima and Kali tends to have more of a Christian flavor. A lot of that stuff is Bullshido, so browse with a discerning eye.

I have no idea how to precisely calculate the information/entropy sacrifice that you'd do by purposefully focusing on something like a prayer, but for fun I calculated the entropy of thinking of a maximum of 7 things at once out of 1 billion possible ones (working memory) plus the maximum entropy of a 206-character sentence (comparable to a short prayer like Hail Mary)
This comes to about 1400 bits of entropy.

This means that a single 1GB entropy sacrifice is as effective as about 748000 Hail Marys if my schizo theory is correct

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33886683
How do you calculate the amount generated/output

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33887167
Shannon entropy, basically
Since every random byte I generate is equally likely as any other byte, I get 8 bits of entropy per random byte
Multiply 8 bits per byte times 1024 bytes in a kilobyte by 1024 kilobytes in a megabyte by 1024 megabytes in a gigabyte and you get a real big number of entropy bits

There was, but the tradition is mostly lost, or buried in obscure mostly untranslated (Arabian) alchemical treatises. Some traces also evident in medieval lore, and even fainter traces evident in treatises on various Rennaisance combat techniques where movements are combined with hermetic correspondences. Certain practices (omphalos psychism etc) survives at Athos, allegedly stemming from pre-Christian neoplatonic methods, but these are locked away from outsiders. Some claim that Gurdjieff's contemplative methods (which where not published until recently) are modiciations of Athos tech. These involve breathing execercises & various manipulations of occult forces in order to effect inner alchemical changes of the human "factory", in order to 'coat' and 'develop' the embryos of higher being bodies, somewhat similar to daoist neidan.

posts.name: The Ape of
posts.com:
>>33895914
One of the big keys of occult training, and a reason why having a solid guru actually matters, is to NOT get sucked into the reasons and wherefores of transient phenomena.

When I scry a fire I can come out with two columns on an 8 an'a half by 11 page full of shit that I saw.

If I tried to pin down the precise theological origins of even some of them, I'd never practice anything ever again.

In magic you will have aural, audial, visual, tactile, taste, and scent disturbances. Your entire sense apparatus will be, uh, probed at for weakness for lack of a better metaphor. Getting sucked into these disturbances is why you end up with folks channeling complete dogshit dumbfuckery. Its why folks think they're The Chosen One. There will always be a quirk in your sensorial environment that reads akin to spiritual significance but without clarity.

This is a feature, not a bug.
